content: The "Mesquite Lands Act of 2007" is also known as the Mesquite Lands Act. It involves the conveyance of land to the City of Mesquite, Nevada. The Mesquite Lands Act of 2007 grants the city of Mesquite, Nevada the exclusive right to purchase specified public land for 12 years. The Bureau of Land Management has prepared a map for this purpose, available for public inspection. The Mesquite Lands Act of 2007 grants Mesquite, Nevada the exclusive right to purchase specified public land. The city must notify the Secretary of the Interior of their intent to purchase within 10 years. The Secretary will then convey the selected land within 1 year. The parcels of public land are withdrawn from public entry and appropriation during this period. Amounts received from land sales will be used accordingly. The Mesquite Lands Act of 2007 grants Mesquite, Nevada the exclusive right to purchase specified public land. Amounts received from land sales will be available for use by the Secretary in Nevada for the Virgin River Multispecies Habitat Conservation Plan. The Mesquite Lands Act of 2007 grants Mesquite, Nevada exclusive rights to purchase public land. Amendments specify new dates for certain provisions related to the implementation of the Multispecies Habitat Conservation Plan. Amendment to the Habitat Conservation Plan includes implementation of the Virgin River Multispecies Habitat Conservation Plan and associated groundwater monitoring plans. Land conveyance for Virgin Valley Water District in Clark County, Nevada. The Secretary of the Interior will convey approximately 300 acres of public land in Clark County, Nevada to the Virgin Valley Water District without cost. The conveyance is subject to existing rights, and the District must reimburse the Secretary for associated costs. If the District sells any part of the land, certain conditions will apply. The District must pay fair market value for any subsequent sale of land conveyed to them by the Secretary. The net proceeds of the sale must be paid to the Secretary. Proceeds received by the Secretary will be available for use in Nevada without further appropriation.
